Sentencas: Enhancing the performance of anode supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells via operating at higher temperatures is of great interest.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, working at a higher temperature leads to a significant rise in thermal stresses over the allowable limit.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thus, in the current study, functionally graded electrodes are considered to avoid cell failure due to higher thermal stresses.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: To assess the cell performance and thermal stress distribution, a theoretical investigation of a solid-oxide fuel cell with a honeycomb configuration using functionally graded electrode compositions is conducted through a comprehensive 3D model.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The developed model includes the charge transport, mass and momentum transport, energy conservation, electrochemical reaction kinetics, and elastic stress.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The model is numerically simulated and validated with the available experimental data.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Results indicate that using functionally graded electrodes with grading index m = 1 significantly improves the fuel cell's performance, with an improvement in power density reaching around 60%.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, the most beneficial improvement is to reduce thermal stresses at elevated temperatures, for which the maximum value of equivalent stress is reduced to 85% less than the conventional electrode at a temperature of 1150 degrees C. Accordingly, the fuel cell's maximum power density can be obtained by operating at elevated temperatures with safe thermal stresses.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These improvements are particularly attractive for applications requiring compact, reliable, and high-power devices based on fuel cell technology.
Titulo: Performance and thermal stresses in functionally graded anode-supported honeycomb solid-oxide fuel cells
